intro: Coccoloba brasiliensis, commonly known as Brazilian spinach, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant is adapted to thrive in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
